message.body: hey! i havr a question. if i am given a X(f) eqn and asked to find x(n) how should i approach it. for eg: X(F) = 2+10cos(2pif)-6cos(4pif).
i though of writing X(f) in terms of exponentials..and then taking the FT of it..then il get shifted impulses. and then i did.that Cn= foX(nfo).. annd th
FT of cos and delta also exist. They're shifted deltas.
you can also break it down into exponentials first. Both ways work.
gotcha! should i worry about quiz 7 stuff? argh the distortionless stuff?
There were no questions about that for me.
hey do u know how to so graphical and analytical convolution in discrete time ? there is a homework problem
and to find the phase angle and magnitude of a sync function?
..uh...I don't know. That also wasn't on the test.
ok thanks. i did the mock.and looked at the last few quizes. i dont know wat else to look at. hmm the ln question on the mock exam... where we had to fin
d x(n),,was the question in the final - related to the ln question difficult? i knw u said it wasnt ln , but was it hard?
That ln problem is nothing more than some tricky algebra to make it look like a FT pair.
ya the ln is easy..because we know how to do it already..but was not sure if he will give a weird looking function where we have no clue of how to approach it
Just relax and do some algebra.
